info.description:
This is the official API documentation for SIMcontrol.
The SIMcontrol API allows developers to manage SIM cards, monitor usage, control rules and data allocation, and integrate various mobile network functionalities into their applications.
info.title: Simcontrol

get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of network names with their respective IDs

Retrieves a paginated list of products.
      Supports filtering by network ID and product type.

parameters.description: Filter recharges by Rule ID. Obtain Rule IDs from the 'Rule Index' endpoint.
parameters.name: rule_id

parameters.description: Start date for recharges, defaults to 1st of the month.
parameters.name: start_date

parameters.description: End date for recharges, defaults to today.
parameters.name: end_date

get.description:
List all Rules for your organisation.
Allows filtering by name, network, product, and SIM ID.

parameters.description: Filter by full or partial Rule name.
parameters.name: name

delete.description: Removes a SIM from a Rule returning `404` if either one of the provided SIM or Rule is not found.

parameters.description: The Rule ID to remove the provided SIM from.
parameters.name: rule_id

post.description:
Adds a SIM to a Rule returning `404` if either one of the provided SIM or Rule is not found.
The provided SIM and Rule must both be active and compatible returning `400` if not.

parameters.description: The Rule ID to add the provided SIM to.
parameters.name: rule_id

get.description:
List all SIMs for your organisation.
Allows filtering by MSISDN, ICCID, IMSI and network.

parameters.description: Partial or full ICCID to filter results.
parameters.name: iccid

parameters.description: Partial or full IMSI to filter results.
parameters.name: imsi

parameters.description: Partial or full MSISDN to filter results.
parameters.name: msisdn

patch.description:
Updates a SIM with the given SIM update attributes.
One identifier field (MSISDN, IMSI, or ICCID) is required to locate the SIM.
Identifier values cannot be updated.

post.description: Creates a new SIM on the specified network.

Activates the specified SIM.
This operation may incur charges and requires sufficient funds in your organisation's account.

get.description:
Retrieve latest balances for a SIM. Results will be POSTed to your
    organisation's configured 'balance callback URL'.

403.description: Organisation is unable to balance check via API.

post.description:
Suspends the specified SIM.
This operation temporarily deactivates the SIM and may affect any active services.

Changes the network for the specified SIM.
One identifier field (MSISDN, IMSI, or ICCID) is required to locate the SIM.

Resets the session connection for an APN SIM.
API rate limited to 1 connection reset request per second.
Disable roaming for the specified SIM.
Enable roaming for the specified SIM.

get.description:
Retrieves a paginated list of usage totals for your organisation's SIMs.
Allows filtering by MSISDN, ICCID, IMSI and IMEI.
Suspended SIMs are omitted by default and can be optionally included.
Results can be limited to a specific date range defaulting to
the beginning of the current month until 'today'.

parameters.description: Partial or full ICCID to filter results.
parameters.name: iccid

parameters.description: Partial or full IMSI to filter results.
parameters.name: imsi

parameters.description: Partial or full MSISDN to filter results.
parameters.name: msisdn

parameters.description: Filter usage totals by Rule ID. Obtain Rule IDs from the 'Rule Index' endpoint.
parameters.name: rule_id

parameters.description: Start date for usages, defaults to 1st of the month.
parameters.name: start_date

parameters.description: End date for usages, defaults to today.
parameters.name: end_date

get.description:
Retrieves a paginated list of usage information by day for a specific SIM.
Identified by either MSISDN, IMEI, IMSI or ICCID.
Results can be limited to a specific date range defaulting to
the beginning of the current month until 'today'.

parameters.description: Start date for usages, defaults to 1st of the month.
parameters.name: start_date

parameters.description: End date for usages, defaults to today.
parameters.name: end_date

tags.description: List, show and create Recharges for SIMs
tags.name: recharges

tags.description: List and show Usage records for SIMS
tags.name: sim_usage

tags.description:
Our API implements rate limiting to ensure fair usage and stability of the service. When making requests to the API, you'll receive rate limit information in the response headers.

## Rate Limit Headers

### x-ratelimit-limit
The maximum number of requests you can make in a given time window.

**Example:** `x-ratelimit-limit: 100`

This indicates you can make up to 100 requests in the current time window.

### x-ratelimit-remaining
The number of requests remaining in your current time window.

**Example:** `x-ratelimit-remaining: 95`

This shows you have 95 requests left before hitting the rate limit.

### x-ratelimit-reset
A Unix timestamp indicating when your current rate limit window will reset.

**Example:** `x-ratelimit-reset: 1644452765`

After this timestamp, your request quota will be fully restored.

### retry-after
When you exceed the rate limit, this header indicates how many seconds to wait before making another request.

**Example:** `retry-after: 60`

This means you should wait 60 seconds before retrying your request.

## Example Response Headers
```http
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
x-ratelimit-limit: 100
x-ratelimit-remaining: 95
x-ratelimit-reset: 1644452765
```

## When You Hit the Rate Limit
If you exceed the rate limit, you'll receive a `429 Too Many Requests` response with headers:

```http
HTTP/1.1 429 Too Many Requests
retry-after: 60
x-ratelimit-limit: 100
x-ratelimit-remaining: 0
x-ratelimit-reset: 1644452765
```

## Best Practices
1. Monitor the `x-ratelimit-remaining` header to track your quota
2. Use the `x-ratelimit-reset` timestamp to determine when you can resume making requests
3. Implement exponential backoff when receiving 429 responses
4. Consider caching responses when appropriate to reduce API calls
tags.name: rate_limiting
